function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Classical format of research funding is slow and may not generate evidence and knowledge fast enough in dynamic situations like a pandemic.","Impact":"Policy makers may not have scientifically informed evidence to make decisions, leading to ineffective policies during a crisis.","Mitigation":"Implement alternative formats that enable faster generation of evidence and knowledge, such as incentivizing transdisciplinary consortia and facilitating data sharing.","Technologies":"Collaborative platforms for data sharing and real-time collaboration, AI for rapid analysis of data, and communication tools for networking and knowledge sharing.","People":"Policy makers, researchers, and the public.","Owner":"EU funding bodies, research institutions, and policy makers."},{"Description":"Competitive nature of funding calls overlooks certain EU regions, leading to limited participation from those areas.","Impact":"Underrepresentation of certain European regions in research and data collection, resulting in biased and incomplete datasets.","Mitigation":"Interpret geographic origin more broadly, incentivize participation from diverse European regions, and dedicate funding or separate calls for coordination and harmonization of multicentric studies.","Technologies":"Collaborative platforms for networking, AI for geographic data analysis, and communication tools for facilitating regional participation.","People":"Researchers from underrepresented regions, data owners from diverse European regions.","Owner":"EU funding bodies, research institutions, and policy makers."},{"Description":"Lack of standard wording for broad informed consent may hinder data sharing and collaboration in research projects.","Impact":"Difficulty in sharing and harmonizing data due to lack of standardized informed consent, leading to inefficiencies and data silos.","Mitigation":"Incorporate standard wording for broad informed consent in call documents, make it a requirement for future consortia, and provide guidance on data sharing best practices.","Technologies":"Data management systems for consent tracking, AI for identifying consent patterns, and communication tools for facilitating consensus on standard wording.","People":"Researchers, data owners, and ethics committees.","Owner":"EU funding bodies, research institutions, and ethics committees."},{"Description":"Knowledge scouting activities are not included, leading to delayed evidence production and limited confirmation of scientific importance.","Impact":"Delay in confirming the scientific importance and usefulness of early project results, reducing their impact on decision making.","Mitigation":"Include knowledge scouting activities as a dedicated work package in research projects to produce evidence while studies are underway and confirm scientific importance and usefulness of early results.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools for real-time evidence production, AI for trend analysis, and communication tools for knowledge sharing and dissemination.","People":"Researchers, policy makers, and the public.","Owner":"EU funding bodies, research institutions, and policy makers."}]}
